description: Nationwide scheme providing all-weather road connectivity to unconnected rural habitations. PMGSY-IV (2024-2029) aims to connect 25,000 new eligible habitations.
target_beneficiaries: Rural habitations lacking all-weather road connectivity
Residents of hill states, tribal areas, desert areas, and LWE-affected districts

other_conditions: Habitation must be unconnected with all-weather road
North-Eastern/Hill States/UTs/Schedule V Areas/Aspirational Districts: Population ≥ 250
Left Wing Extremism (LWE) affected areas: Population ≥ 100
Contractors bidding for projects must be Class-A and above with relevant experience in hill cutting/hill road construction

benefits: Construction of 62,500 km of all-weather roads under PMGSY-IV
Construction of bridges along road alignments
Vehicle Tracking System (VTS)/GPS installation on all construction equipment
Access to markets, education, and healthcare

steps: State Government finalizes proposals and sanctions projects
State Rural Roads Development Agency implements construction
